com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface Layer

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable
All Known Subinterfaces:
DatasetLayer, FeatureGraphicsLayer, FeatureLayer, GraphicsLayer, GroupLayer, ImageLayer, ImageServerLayer, Layerset, SelectableLayer
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseDatasetLayer, BaseFeatureGraphicsLayer, BaseFeatureLayer, BaseGraphicsLayer, BaseGroupLayer, BaseImageLayer, BaseImageServerLayer, BaseLayer, BaseLayerset
public interface Layer
extends Cloneable

A Layer is a visual representation of a Dataset or a group of Datasets. When the container Map chooses to draw its layers, it invokes the draw() method of each layer, at which point the Layer must render the data in its Dataset, or cause the constituent Layers (if it is a GroupLayer) to draw themselves.

See Also:
Map, Layerset, DatasetLayer, GroupLayer, Dataset

          Identifier for getNeedsRedraw indicating that a redraw is required usually because rendering data has changed - a resulting redraw is likely to cause artifacts unless the map is cleared

          Identifier for getNeedsRedraw indicating that nothing needs to be redrawn
static int REDRAW_PARTIAL
          Identifier for getNeedsRedraw indicating that a redraw is required to be able to view new data - a resulting redraw will not cause overdrawing artifacts

Method Detail

clone

public Object clone()
Returns a clone(copy) of this Layer Object

Overrides:
clone in class Object
Returns:
a copy of this Layer object

draw

public void draw(DisplayArea displayArea,
                 int drawPhase)
          throws InterruptedException
Draws itself on the given portion of a display. A DisplayManager will callback a Layer up to three times during the "draw phases" appropriate for drawing features, selected features, and labels. This method will normally take the current visibility and map scale into account, and draw or not draw if the Layer is currently shown.

Parameters:
displayArea - the portion of a display
drawPhase - one of the draw phase identifiers
Throws:
InterruptedException - if Layer drawing has been cancelled (usually because of a new zoom or pan)
See Also:
DRAW_FEATURE, DRAW_SELECT, DRAW_LABEL, isShown(), drawWithinScale(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int)

drawWithinScale

public void drawWithinScale(DisplayArea displayArea,
                            int drawPhase)
                     throws InterruptedException
Draws the Layer regardless of visibility or current scale. It otherwise functions the same as draw()

Parameters:
displayArea - the portion of the display
drawPhase - one of the draw phase identifiers
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the layer drawing has been cancelled
See Also:
draw(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int)

public void setLayerSource(LayerSource source)
Sets the given LayerSource to this Layer. When a LayerSource creates a Layer, it will call this method with a reference to itself.

Parameters:
source - the creating LayerSource

setParent

public void setParent(GroupLayer parent)
When this Layer is added to or removed from a GroupLayer, the GroupLayer will use this method to tell the Layer what its parent is.

Parameters:
parent - the parent GroupLayer, or null == the Layer has been removed from a GroupLayer

Returns the LayerInfo that was used to create this Layer. This is only available for Layers that were created by a LayerSource

Returns:
the LayerInfo, or null == this Layer was not created by a LayerSource

layerInfo - the layer info

getNeedsRedraw

public int getNeedsRedraw(int type)
When the properties of a Layer changes, this method indicates if a redraw of a particular type is required - either features, labels, or selection. Furthermore, it indicates whether a redraw of the Layer would cause overdrawing artifacts to appear - typically as a consequence, a Map will choose to clear the screen and completely redraw all Layers.

Parameters:
type - is one of the following values DRAW_FEATURE, DRAW_SELECT or DRAW_LABEL
Returns:
one of following values REDRAW_NONE, REDRAW_PARTIAL or REDRAW_FULL

setNeedsRedraw

public void setNeedsRedraw(int type,
                           int b)
Sets value of NeedsRedraw property for specified redraw type.

Parameters:
type - is one of DRAW_FEATURE, DRAW_SELECT or DRAW_LABEL
b - one of REDRAW_NONE, REDRAW_PARTIAL or REDRAW_FULL
See Also:
getNeedsRedraw(int)

setNeedsRedraw

public void setNeedsRedraw(int b)
Sets value of NeedsRedraw property for all redraw types.

Parameters:
b - one of the following values REDRAW_NONE, REDRAW_PARTIAL or REDRAW_FULL
See Also:
setNeedsRedraw(int,int)

setMaximumScale

public void setMaximumScale(double scale)
Sets the maximum scale value above which the Layer stops being visible. Note: "scale" in this context refers to the number of world coordinates represented by a single pixel. You normally obtain this value from the getScale() method of a Map's PixelToWorldTransform property

Parameters:
scale - the new maximum scale value
See Also:
Map.getPixelToWorldTransform()

getMaximumScale

public double getMaximumScale()
Returns the maximum scale value.

Returns:
the maximum scale value
See Also:
setMaximumScale(double), DEFAULT_MAXSCALE

public void setMinimumScale(double scale)
Sets the minimum scale value below which the Layer stops being visible.

Parameters:
scale - the new minimum scale value
See Also:
setMaximumScale(double), DEFAULT_MINSCALE

getMinimumScale

public double getMinimumScale()
Returns the minimum scale value.

Returns:
the minimum scale value
See Also:
setMinimumScale(double)

clearScales

public void clearScales()
Removes both maximum and minimum scales. Actually, this just sets the minimum to 0.0 and the maximum to Double.MAX_VALUE

isOutOfScaleRange

public boolean isOutOfScaleRange(double scale)
Determines if the Layer will draw at the specified scale.

Parameters:
scale - the scale to test
Returns:
true == scale is outside the scale range and won't draw, false == otherwise
See Also:
setMinimumScale(double), setMaximumScale(double)

isShown

public boolean isShown()
Determines whether the Layer is currently shown in the Map, based on the Layer's isVisible and isOutOfScaleRange properties. Using this method only makes sense for Layers that have been added to a Map. If the Layer has not been added to a Map, then by default this method returns the same as isVisible(). The associated method isOutOfScaleRange(double) is used once the scale has been determined from the Map

Returns:
true if the layer is shown, false otherwise
See Also:
isOutOfScaleRange(double)

hasExtension

public boolean hasExtension(String id)
Determines if this Layer has a particular LayerExtension or not

Parameters:
id - the LayerExtension ID
Returns:
true == the extension is present, false otherwise
See Also:
LayerExtension

getExtensionIDs

public String[] getExtensionIDs()
Returns all LayerExtensions associated with this Layer.

Returns:
an array containing the ids of the extensions, a zero-length array indicates no extensions

getExtension

public LayerExtension getExtension(String id)
Returns a LayerExtension associated with this Layer, specified by its LayerExtension ID

Parameters:
id - the LayerExtension ID
Returns:
the LayerExtension, or null if it is not present

setExtension

public void setExtension(LayerExtension extension)
Adds or changes a LayerExtension associated with this Layer. If a LayerExtension with thespecified ID is already present, then it will be replaced by the new one.

Parameters:
extension - the LayerExtension
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if extension is null

removeExtension

public void removeExtension(String id)
Removes a LayerExtension associated with this Layer, specified by its LayerExtension ID. Operation is ignored if the LayerExtension is not present

Parameters:
id - the LayerExtension ID

getMapScale

public double getMapScale()
Returns the current map scale. Only useful if this Layer has been added to a Map

Returns:
the current map scale, or 0 == not currently added to a Map

getMapSize

public Dimension getMapSize()
Returns the current map size. Only useful if this Layer has been added to a Map

Returns:
the current map size, or null == not currently added to a Map

getCapabilities

public LayerCapabilities getCapabilities()
Returns this Layer's capabilities

Returns:
the layer's capabilities

getId

public String getId()
obtains a string identifier associated with a layer. setId() method should be used first to sep up the identifier.

Returns:
the identifier or null, if the identifier has not been set up

setId

public void setId(String id)
allows to set up a string identifier for a layer. This identifier might be used in several ways. For instance, it can be used to guarantee uniqueness of a layer in a layer set.
